text: Paul, slave of Jesus, the Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God
speaker: Narrator

text: (which he had promised before by his prophets in the holy scriptures)
speaker: Narrator

text: of his Son (who was born unto him of the seed of David according to the flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the Spirit of sanctification, by the resurrection from the dead), of Jesus, the Christ, our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: By whom we have received the grace and the apostleship, to cause the faith to be obeyed among all the Gentiles in his name,
speaker: Narrator

text: among whom ye are also the called of Jesus Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: to all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints; ye have grace and peace of God our Father and of the Lord Jesus, the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: First, I thank my God through Jesus, the Christ, regarding you all, that your faith is preached in all the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I always remember you in my prayers,
speaker: Narrator

text: making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I long to see you that I may impart with you some spiritual gift to confirm you,
speaker: Narrator

text: that is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that many times I purposed to come unto you (but up until now I have been unable) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am debtor both to the Greeks and to the Barbarians; both to the wise and to the unwise.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to announce the gospel to you that are at Rome also.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of the Christ; for it is the power of God to give saving health to every one that believes: to the Jew first and also to the Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in him is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith, as it is written, The just shall live by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and injustice of men, who hold back the truth with injustice;
speaker: Narrator

text: because that which is known of God is manifest to them; for God has showed it unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the invisible things of him, his eternal power and divinity, are clearly understood by the creation of the world and by the things that are made so that there is no excuse;
speaker: Narrator

text: because having known God, they did not glorify him as God, neither were thankful, but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools
speaker: Narrator

text: and exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man and of birds and of fourfooted beasts and of serpents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore God also gave them over to the lusts of their own hearts for uncleanness, to contaminate their own bodies between themselves,
speaker: Narrator

text: who changed the truth of God into a lie and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed for all ages. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this cause God gave them up unto shameful affections, for even their women changed the natural use into that which is against nature;
speaker: Narrator

text: and likewise also the males, leaving the natural use of the females, burned in their lust one toward another, males with males committing nefarious works and receiving in themselves the recompense that proceeded from their error.
speaker: Narrator

text: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a perverse understanding, to do those things which are not convenient,
speaker: Narrator

text: being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,
speaker: Narrator

text: backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,
speaker: Narrator

text: without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, implacable, without mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who having understood the righteousness of God, they did not understand that those who do such things are worthy of death, not only those that do the same, but even those who encourage those that do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest; for in that which thou dost judge another, thou dost condemn thyself; for thou that judgest others doest the same things.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are sure that the judgment of God is according to the truth against those who do such things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And dost thou think this, O man, that judgest those who do such things and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or dost thou despise the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering, ignoring that the goodness of God leads thee to repentance?
speaker: Narrator

text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasures up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who will render to everyone according to his deeds:
speaker: Narrator

text: to those who persevered in well doing, glory and honour and incorruption, to those who seek eternal life;
speaker: Narrator

text: but unto those that are contentious and do not obey the truth, but are persuaded by unrighteousness, indignation and wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tribulation and anguish shall be upon every human soul that does evil, the Jew first and also the Greek;
speaker: Narrator

text: but glory, honour, and peace to everyone that works good, to the Jew first and also to the Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is no respect of persons with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law, and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law
speaker: Narrator

text: (for not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified;
speaker: Narrator

text: for when the Gentiles, who do not have the law, do by nature that which is of the law, these, not having the law, are a law unto themselves;
speaker: Narrator

text: which show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, accusing and also excusing their reasonings one with another)
speaker: Narrator

text: in the day when God shall judge that which men have covered up, according to my gospel by Jesus, the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou doth call thyself a Jew and art supported by the law and doth glory in God
speaker: Narrator

text: and dost know his will and approve the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law,
speaker: Narrator

text: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of those who are in darkness,
speaker: Narrator

text: an instructor of the ignorant, a teacher of children, who hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou, therefore, who teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? Thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? Thou that dost abhor idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, with rebellion to the law doth thou dishonour God?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.
speaker: Narrator

text: For circumcision verily profits if thou keep the law, but if thou art a rebel to the law, thy circumcision is made into a foreskin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if the uncircumcised keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his foreskin be counted for circumcision?
speaker: Narrator

text: And that which is by nature foreskin, but keeps the law perfectly, shall judge thee who with the letter and with the circumcision art rebellious to the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly, neither is circumcision that which is done outwardly in the flesh;
speaker: Narrator

text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit and not in the letter, whose praise is not of men, but of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: What advantage then has the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?
speaker: Narrator

text: Much in every way: first, certainly, that the oracles of God have been entrusted unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what if some of them did not believe? Shall their unbelief have made the truth of God without effect?
speaker: Narrator

text: No, in no wise: for God is true, and every man a liar; as it is written, That thou might be justified in thy words and might overcome when thou dost judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if our iniquity commends the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Shall for this reason God be unjust who sends punishment? (I speak as a man.)
speaker: Narrator

text: No, in no wise: for then how shall God judge the world?
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the truth of God has more abounded through my lie unto his glory, why even so am I also judged as a sinner?
speaker: Narrator

text: And why not say (as we are slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say), Let us do evil, that good may come? The condemnation of whom is just.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then? Are we better than they? No, in no wise; for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles that they are all under sin;
speaker: Narrator

text: as it is written, There is no one righteous, no, not one;
speaker: Narrator

text: there is no one that understands; there is no one that seeks after God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are all gone out of the way; they are together become unprofitable; there is no one that does good, no, not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness;
speaker: Narrator

text: their feet are swift to shed blood;
speaker: Narrator

text: destruction and misery are in their ways,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the way of peace they have not known;
speaker: Narrator

text: there is no fear of God before their eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we know that all that the law says, it says to those who are under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may submit themselves unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by the deeds of the law, no flesh shall be justified in his sight; for by the law is the knowledge of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, without the law, the righteousness of God has been manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets:
speaker: Narrator

text: the righteousness, that is, of God by the faith of Jesus, the Christ, for all and upon all those that believe in him, for there is no difference;
speaker: Narrator

text: for all have sinned and are made destitute of the glory of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Jesus, the Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: whom God purposed for reconciliation through faith in his blood for the manifestation of his righteousness, for the remission of sins that are past, by the patience of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: manifesting in this time his righteousness that he only be the just one and the justifier of him that is of the faith of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? No, but by the law of faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is he the God of the Jews only? Is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also,
speaker: Narrator

text: seeing it is one God who shall justify the circumcision by faith and the uncircumcision by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do we then make void the law through faith? No, in no wise; to the contrary, we establish the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall we say then that Abraham our father, as pertaining to the flesh, has found?
speaker: Narrator

text: For if Abraham were justified by works, he has reason to glory in himself, but not before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what does the scripture say? Abraham believed God, and it was counted unto him for righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto him that works, the reward is not reckoned as grace, but as debt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to him that does not work, but believes in him that justifies the ungodly, the faith is counted as righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even as David also describes the blessedness of the man unto whom God doth attribute righteousness without works,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, Blessed are those whose iniquities are forgiven and whose sins are covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord does not impute sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is this blessedness, therefore, only upon the circumcision or also upon the uncircumcision? for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham as righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: How was it then reckoned? when he was in circumcision or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he received the circumcision as a sign, as a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had, yet being uncircumcised, that he might be the father of all the uncircumcised believers, that it might be counted unto them also as righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: that he be the father of the circumcision: not only to those who are of the circumcision, but also unto those who walk in the steps of the faith that was in our father Abraham before he was circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the promise that he should be the heir of the world was not to Abraham or to his seed through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if those who are of the law are the heirs, faith is in vain, and the promise annulled,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the law works wrath; for where there is no law, there is no rebellion either.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore by faith, that it might be by grace, to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed, not only to that which is of the law, but also to that which is of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all,
speaker: Narrator

text: as it is written, As a father of many Gentiles have I placed thee before God, whom he believed, who gives life to the dead and calls those things which are not as those that are.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who believed to wait against all hope, that he might become the father of many Gentiles, according to that which had been spoken unto him, So shall thy seed be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did not weaken in faith: he considered not his own body now dead when he was about one hundred years old, neither yet the deadness of Sara’s womb;
speaker: Narrator

text: he doubted not the promise of God, with unbelief, but was strengthened in faith, giving glory to God,
speaker: Narrator

text: being fully persuaded that he was also powerful to do all that he had promised;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, his faith was also attributed unto him as righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it is not written for his sake alone that it was so reckoned to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but for us also to whom it shall be so reckoned, that is, to those that believe in him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was delivered for our offenses and was raised again for our justification.
speaker: Narrator

text: Justified therefore by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus, the Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: by whom we also have access by faith into this grace in which we stand and glory in hope of the glory of the sons of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not only this, but we even glory in the tribulations, knowing that the tribulation works patience;
speaker: Narrator

text: and patience, experience; and experience, hope;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the hope shall not be ashamed, because the love of God is poured out in our hearts by the Holy Spirit which is given unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Christ, when we were yet weak, in his time died for the ungodly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die, yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God increased the price of his charity toward us in that while we were yet sinners the Christ died for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then much more now justified in his blood, we shall be saved from wrath by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled with God by the death of his Son, much more, now reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not only this, but we even glory in God through our Lord Jesus, the Christ, by whom we have now received the reconciliation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, in the manner which sin entered into the world by one man, and because of sin, death; and so death passed upon all men in the one in whom all sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text: For until the law, sin was in the world; but the sin was not imputed, there being no law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even in those that did not sin after the manner of the rebellion of Adam, who is a figure of him that was to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: But not as the offense, so also is the gift. For if through the offense of that one many died, much more the grace of God and the gift by the grace of one man, Jesus the Christ, has abounded unto many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor was it in the same manner as by one sin, likewise also the gift; for the judgment truly came of one sin unto condemnation, but grace came of many offenses unto justification.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if by one offense, death reigned because of one man; much more those who receive the abundance of grace and of gifts and of righteousness shall reign in life by one, Jesus the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, in the same manner that by the iniquity of one guilt came upon all men unto condemnation, even so by the righteousness of one, grace came upon all men unto justification of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as by one man’s disobedience, many were made sinners, so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the law entered that the offence might abound. But where sin abounded, grace did much more abound,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that in the same manner as sin has reigned unto death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus, the Christ, our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin that grace may abound?
speaker: Narrator

text: No, in no wise. How shall we that are dead to sin live any longer therein?
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye not that all of us that are baptized into Jesus the Christ are baptized into his death?
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are buried with him by baptism into death, that just as the Christ was raised up from the dead to the glory of the Father, likewise we also walk in newness of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if we have been planted together in him in the likeness of his death, we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing this: that our old man is crucified with him that the body of sin might be destroyed that we should not serve sin any longer.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that is dead is justified from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if we die with the Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that the Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more; death has no more dominion over him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that is dead died unto sin once, and he that lives, lives unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also reckon yourselves to be truly dead unto sin, but alive unto God in Christ, Jesus, our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither present your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin, but present yourselves unto God as those that are alive from the dead and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that sin shall have no dominion over you; for ye are not under the law, but under grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then? shall we sin because we are not under the law, but under grace? No, in no wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or know ye not that to whom ye present yourselves slaves to obey, his slaves ye are to whom ye obey, whether of sin unto death or of the obedience unto righteousness?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thank God that, although ye were the slaves of sin, ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine unto which ye are delivered;
speaker: Narrator

text: and freed from sin, ye are become the slaves of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak a human thing because of the weakness of our flesh: that as ye presented your members to serve uncleanness and iniquity unto iniquity, likewise now present your members to serve righteousness unto holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For being previously the slaves of sin, now ye have been made the slaves of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: What fruit had ye then in those things of which ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now freed from sin and made slaves to God, ye have as your fruit sanctification and as the end, everlasting life.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the wages of sin is death, but the grace of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye not, brethren (for I speak to those that know the law), that the law has dominion over a man only as long as he lives?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the woman who is subject to a husband is obligated to the law so long as the husband lives; but if the husband dies, she is free from the law of the husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then if, while her husband lives, she belongs to another man, she shall be called an adulteress; but if her husband dies, she is free from that law so that she is no adulteress if she belongs to another man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise ye also, my brethren, are become dead to the law in the body of the Christ that ye should belong to another, even to him who is raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For while we were in the flesh, the affections of the sins which were by the law worked in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now we are free from the law of death in which we were held, that we might serve in newness of Spirit, and not in the oldness of the letter.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall we say then? Is the law sin? No, in no wise. But, I did not know sin except by the law; for neither would I have known lust if the law did not say, Thou shalt not covet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then sin, when there was occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of lust. For without the law sin was as if it were dormant.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that without the law I lived for some time; but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I found that the same commandment, which was unto life, was mortal unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For sin, having had occasion, deceived me by the commandment and by it killed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the law is truly holy, and the commandment holy and just and good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Was then that which is good made death unto me? No, in no wise. But sin, to show itself sin by that which is good, worked death in me, making sin exceedingly sinful by the commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we now know that the law is spiritual, but I am carnal, sold unto subjection by sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For that which I do, I do not understand, and not even the good that I desire is what I do; but what I hate, that is what I do.
speaker: Narrator

text: If then I do that which I do not desire, I approve that the law is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that it is no longer I that do it, but sin that dwells in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I know that in me (that is, in my flesh) dwells no good thing; for I have the desire, but I am not able to perform that which is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I do not do the good that I desire; but the evil which I do not desire, that I do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I do that which I do not desire, I am not working, but sin that dwells in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that, desiring to do good, I find this law: evil is natural unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I delight with the law of God with the inward man,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I see another law in my members which rebels against the law of my mind, bringing captive unto the law of sin which is in my members.
speaker: Narrator

text: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of God, by Jesus, the Christ, our Lord. So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God, but with the flesh the law of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that now, there is no condemnation to those who are in Christ, Jesus, who walk not according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ, Jesus, has made me free from the law of sin and death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For that which was impossible to the law, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh
speaker: Narrator

text: that the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us who walk not according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those that are according to the flesh know the things that are of the flesh; but those that are according to the Spirit, the things that are of the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the prudence of the flesh is death, but the prudence of the Spirit, life and peace,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the prudence of the flesh is enmity against God; for it does not subject itself to the law of God, neither indeed can it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, those that are carnal cannot please God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, because the Spirit of God dwells in you. Now if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, that person is not of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if Christ is in you, the body is truly dead because of sin, but the Spirit is alive because of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he that raised up the Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwells in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live according to the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye live according to the flesh, ye shall die; but if through the Spirit ye mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all that are led by the Spirit of God, the same are sons of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye have not received the spirit of slavery to be in fear again, but ye have received the Spirit of adoption of sons, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the same Spirit bears witness unto our spirit that we are sons of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if sons, also heirs certainly of God and joint-heirs with Christ, if so be that we suffer with him that we may be also glorified together with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know with certainty that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the coming glory which shall be manifested in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the earnest hope of the creatures waits for the manifestation of the sons of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the creatures were subjected to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who has subjected them,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the hope that the same creatures shall be delivered from the slavery of corruption into the glorious liberty of the sons of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we now know that all the creatures groan together and travail in pain together until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not only they, but ourselves also who have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, that is to say, the redemption of our body.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in hope we are saved, but hope that is seen is not hope; for what a man sees, he does not wait for.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we wait for that which we do not see, with patience we wait for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise also the Spirit helps our weakness; for we know not how to pray as we ought, but the Spirit itself makes entreaty for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that searches the hearts knows what is the desire of the Spirit, that according to the will of God, he makes entreaty for the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we now know that unto those who love God, all things help them unto good, to those who according to the purpose are called to be saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto those who he knew beforehand, he also marked out beforehand the way that they might be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto those whom he did mark out beforehand the way, to these he also called; and to whom he called, these he also justified; and to whom he justified, these he also glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall we then say to these things? If God is for us, who shall be against us?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that did not spare his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not also give us all things with him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall accuse the chosen of God’s? God is he that justifies them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is he that condemns them? Christ, Jesus, is he who died and, even more, he that also rose again, who furthermore is at the right hand of God, who also makes entreaty for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall separate us from the charity of Christ? shall tribulation or distress or persecution or famine or nakedness or peril or sword?
speaker: Narrator

text: (As it is written, For thy sake we are killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I am certain that neither death nor life nor angels nor principalities nor powers nor things present nor things to come
speaker: Narrator

text: nor height nor depth nor any creature shall be able to separate us from the charity of God, which is in Christ, Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say the truth in Christ, I do not lie, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I have great sorrow and continual pain in my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I could wish that myself were anathema from Christ for my brethren, those who are my kinsmen according to the flesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: who are Israelites, to whom pertains the adoption as sons and the glory and the covenants and the giving of the law and the service of God and the promises,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose are the fathers, and of whom as concerning the flesh is the Christ, who is God over all things, blessed for all the ages. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not as though the word of God has been deficient. For not all the descendants of Israel are Israelites;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither, because they are the seed of Abraham, are all sons, but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is, Those who are sons of the flesh, these are not the sons of God; but those who are sons of the promise are counted in the generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the word of the promise is this, At this time I will come, and Sara shall have a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not only this, but when Rebecca also had conceived by one, even by our father Isaac
speaker: Narrator

text: (for the children being not yet born, neither having done any good or evil, that the purpose of God according to election might stand: not of works, but of him that calls),
speaker: Narrator

text: it was said unto her, The elder shall serve the younger.
speaker: Narrator

text: As it is written, Jacob have I loved, but Esau have I hated.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall we say then? Is there injustice in God? No, in no wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then it is not of him that wills, nor of him that runs, but of God that has mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the scripture saith of Pharaoh, Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up, that I might show my power in thee and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he has mercy on whom he will have mercy, and he hardens whom he will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why does he become angry? For who shall resist his will?
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather, O man, who art thou to reply against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it, Why hast thou made me thus?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour and another unto dishonour?
speaker: Narrator

text: What if God, desiring to show his wrath and to make his power known, endured with much meekness the vessels of wrath, prepared for death,
speaker: Narrator

text: and making known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy, which he has prepared unto glory?
speaker: Narrator

text: Even us, whom he has called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles!
speaker: Narrator

text: As he saith also in Hosea, I will call them my people, who were not my people, and her beloved, who was not beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass that in the place where it was said unto them, Ye are not my people, there shall they be called sons of the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Isaiah also cries out concerning Israel, Though the number of the sons of Israel be as the sand of the sea, only a remnant shall be saved;
speaker: Narrator

text: when the consumption comes to an end, righteousness shall overflow, because a short sentence will the Lord execute upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Isaiah said before, Except the Lord of the hosts had left us a seed, we had been as Sodom and been made like unto Gomorrha.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, who did not follow after righteousness, have attained to righteousness, that is to say, the righteousness which is by faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Israel, which followed after the law of righteousness, has not attained to the law of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why? Because they followed it not by faith but, as it were, by the works (of the law); therefore, they stumbled on the stumblingstone;
speaker: Narrator

text: as it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock that will cause some to fall, and whosoever believes in him shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, certainly the desire of my heart and my prayer to God regarding Israel, is for saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I give testimony that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they, being ignorant of God’s righteousness and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Christ is the end of the law, to give righteousness to every one that believes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses describes the righteousness which is by the law, That the man who does those things shall live by them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thus saith the righteousness which is by faith, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven (that is, to bring the Christ down from above)?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or, Who shall descend into the deep (that is, to bring up the Christ again from the dead)?
speaker: Narrator

text: But what does it say? The word is near thee, even in thy mouth and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach,
speaker: Narrator

text: that if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus and shalt believe in thine heart that God has raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with the heart one believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the scripture says, Whosoever believes on him shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek, for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher?
speaker: Narrator

text: And how shall they preach if they have not been sent? as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of those that announce the gospel of peace, of those that announce the gospel of that which is good!
speaker: Narrator

text: But not everyone hearkens unto the gospel. For Isaiah says, Lord, who has believed our report?
speaker: Narrator

text: So then faith comes by hearing, and the ear to hear by the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say, Have they not heard? Yes verily, their fame went into all the earth, and their words unto the ends of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say, Did not Israel know? First Moses says, I will provoke you unto jealousy with people that are not mine, and with ignorant people I will provoke you to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Isaiah is very bold and says, I was found by those that did not seek me; I manifested myself unto those that did not ask after me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And against Israel he says, All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say then, Has God cast away his people? No, in no wise. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has not cast away his people whom he knew beforehand. Know ye not what the scripture says of Elijah? how speaking to God against Israel, he said,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, they have killed thy prophets and ruined thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But what did the answer of God say unto him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee before Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even so then at this present time also, there is a remnant by the gracious election of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if by grace, then is it not by works; otherwise, the grace is no longer grace. But if it is of works, then it is no longer grace; otherwise, the work is no longer work.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then? Israel has not obtained that which he seeks after; but the elect have obtained it, and the rest were blinded
speaker: Narrator

text: (according as it is written, God has given them the spirit of anguish, eyes with which they do not see and ears with which they do not hear) unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David says, Let their table be turned into a snare and a net and a stumblingblock and a recompense unto them;
speaker: Narrator

text: Let their eyes be darkened that they may not see, and bow down their back always.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say then, Have they stumbled in such a manner that they should fall completely? No, in no wise; but rather through their fall, saving health is come unto the Gentiles to provoke them unto jealousy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the fall of them is the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles, how much more shall their fullness be?
speaker: Narrator

text: For (I call you Gentiles) inasmuch as I am truly the apostle of the Gentiles, my honorable ministry,
speaker: Narrator

text: if in any manner I may provoke my nation to jealousy and cause some of them to be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the casting away of them is the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the firstfruit is holy, so shall the rest be; and if the root is holy, so shall be the branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if some of the branches were broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert grafted in among them and hath been made participant of the root and of the fatness of the olive tree,
speaker: Narrator

text: do not boast against the branches. But if thou boast, know that thou dost not bear the root, but the root thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off that I might be grafted in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good; because of their unbelief they were broken off, but thou by faith art standing. Do not be highminded, but fear
speaker: Narrator

text: that if God did not forgive the natural branches, neither shall he forgive thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, therefore, the goodness and severity of God: on those who fell, severity, but toward thee, goodness if thou continue in his goodness; otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And even them, if they do not continue in unbelief, shall be grafted in, for God is powerful enough to graft them in again.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature and wert grafted contrary to nature into the good olive tree, how much more shall these, which are the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?
speaker: Narrator

text: For I would not, brethren, that ye ignore this mystery, that ye not be arrogant regarding yourselves: that blindness in part has happened in Israel, until the fullness of the Gentiles are come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And even if all Israel were saved, as it is written: There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall take away the ungodliness from Jacob;
speaker: Narrator

text: and this shall be my covenant unto them when I shall take away their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that, as concerning the gospel, I have them for enemies for your sakes; but as touching the election of God, they are beloved for the fathers’ sakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as ye in time past have not obeyed God, yet have now obtained mercy through the occasion of their disobedience,
speaker: Narrator

text: likewise these also have not believed now that through the mercy shown unto you they also may obtain mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God enclosed everyone in disobedience, that he might have mercy upon everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and of the knowledge of God! How incomprehensible are his judgments and his ways past finding out!
speaker: Narrator

text: For who has understood the intent of the Lord? or who has been his counsellor?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or who has first given unto him, that it be recompensed unto him again?
speaker: Narrator

text: For of him and by him and in him are all things. To him be the glory for the ages. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I beseech you brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies in living sacrifice, holy, well pleasing unto God, which is your rational worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: And be not conformed to this age, but be ye transformed by the renewing of your soul that ye may experience what is that good and well pleasing and perfect will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I say through the grace given unto me, to all those that are among you not to obtain more knowledge than is prudent to know, but to obtain knowledge with temperance, each one according to the measure of faith that God has dealt.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the manner that we have many members in one body, nevertheless all the members do not have the same operation;
speaker: Narrator

text: likewise many of us are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that having different gifts according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, according to the measure of faith;
speaker: Narrator

text: or ministry, in serving; or he that teaches, in doctrine;
speaker: Narrator

text: he that exhorts, in exhortation; he that gives, let him do it in simplicity; he that presides, in earnest care; he that shows mercy, in cheerfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let love be without dissimulation, abhorring that which is evil, causing you to come unto that which is good;
speaker: Narrator

text: loving one another with brotherly love, with honour preferring one another;
speaker: Narrator

text: not slothful in earnest care, but fervent in the Spirit, serving the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: rejoicing in hope, patient in tribulation, constant in prayer,
speaker: Narrator

text: sharing for the needs of the saints, and given to hospitality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless those who persecute you: bless, and do not curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice with those that rejoice and weep with those that weep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be unanimous among yourselves, not high minded, but accommodating the humble. Do not be wise in your own opinion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not repaying anyone evil for evil; procuring that which is good not only in the sight of God, but even in the sight of all men.
speaker: Narrator

text: If it can be done, as much as is possible on your part, live in peace with all men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not defending yourselves, dearly beloved; but rather give place unto the wrath of God, for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, if thine enemy hungers, feed him; if he thirsts, give him drink; for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let every soul submit itself to the higher powers. For there is no power but of God, and the powers that be are ordained of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever therefore resists the power, resists the ordinance of God, and those that resist shall receive condemnation to themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the magistrates are not a terror unto those who do good, but to the doer of evil. Is thy desire therefore to not fear the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he is a minister of God for thy good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he does not bear the sword in vain, for he is a minister of God, a revenger to execute wrath upon him that does evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it is necessary that ye be subject, not only for punishment, but also for conscience sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this cause ye also pay them tribute, for they are God’s ministers, attending continually to this very thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Owe no one anything, but love one unto another; for he that loves his neighbour has fulfilled the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not murder, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not covet, and if there is any other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Charity works no evil to a neighbour; therefore, charity is the fulfillment of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awaken ourselves out of sleep, for now is our saving health nearer than when we believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The night is past, and the day is come; let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us clothe ourselves with the weapons of light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us walk honestly, as in the day, not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be clothed with the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not listen to the flesh, to fulfil its desires.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bear with the one who is sick in the faith, but not unto doubtful discernment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For one believes that he may eat all things; another, who is sick, eats vegetables.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not him that eats despise him that does not eat, and let not him who does not eat judge him that eats; for God has raised him up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? By his own master he stands or falls; and if he falls, he shall be made to stand, for God is powerful to make him stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, some make a difference between one day and another; others esteem every day alike. Let each one be fully persuaded in his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that observes the day, let him observe it unto the Lord; and he that does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe it. He that eats, eats unto the Lord, for he gives God thanks; and he that does not eat, unto the Lord he does not eat, and gives God thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For none of us live for ourselves, and no one dies for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if we live, we live for the Lord; and if we die, we die for the Lord; whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to this end Christ both died and rose and revived: to thus exercise lordship over the dead as well as over the living.
speaker: Narrator

text: But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou belittle thy brother? for we shall all stand before the tribunal of the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then each one of us shall give account of himself to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us, therefore, not judge one another any more, but judge this rather: that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother’s way.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know and trust in the Lord Jesus that for his sake there is nothing unclean, but to him that esteems any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thy brother is grieved because of thy food, now thou dost not walk in charity. Do not destroy him with thy food, for whom Christ died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not then your good be evil spoken of;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the kingdom of God is not food and drink, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that in these things serves the Christ is well pleasing unto God and approved of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us, therefore, follow after the things which make for peace and the edification of each one to the others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of food, do not destroy the work of God. All things indeed are clean, but it is evil for that man who eats with offense.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is good neither to eat flesh nor to drink wine nor do any thing by which thy brother stumbles or is offended or is sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast faith; have it to thyself before God. Blessed is he that does not condemn himself with that thing which he allows.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that makes a difference is condemned if he eats, because he does not eat by faith; and whatsoever is not out of faith is sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: We then that are stronger ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not please ourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let each one of us please his neighbour in that which is good, unto edification.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Christ did not please himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of those that reproached thee fell on me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the things that were written beforehand were written for our instruction that we, through patient endurance and through the comfort of the scriptures, might have hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be unanimous among yourselves according to Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye may with one accord and one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore bear one another, as the Christ also bore us, to the glory of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I say that Christ Jesus, was a minister of the circumcision, by the truth of God, to confirm the promises made unto the fathers;
speaker: Narrator

text: but that the Gentiles glorify God by mercy; as it is written, For this cause I will confess thee among the Gentiles and sing unto thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he says, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and magnify him, all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again, Isaiah says, There shall be a root of Jesse and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles; in him the Gentiles shall wait for salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And believing, the God of hope fills you with all joy and peace that ye may abound in hope by the virtue of the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am convinced regarding you, my brethren, that even without my exhortation ye are full of charity, full of all knowledge, so as to be able to admonish one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless I have written, brethren, in part boldly, as admonishing you by the grace that is given to me of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: being the minister of Jesus Christ, to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering of the Gentiles might be well pleasing, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have something to boast of in Christ Jesus, with regard to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ has not wrought by me, unto the obedience of the Gentiles, with word and with deed,
speaker: Narrator

text: with power of signs and wonders, in virtue of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem and round about unto Illyricum, I have filled the entire area with the gospel of the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this manner I preached this gospel, not where Christ had been named previously, not to build upon a foundation belonging to another,
speaker: Narrator

text: but, as it is written, To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see, and those that have not heard shall understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: For which reason I have even been hindered many times from coming to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now having more place in these parts and having a great desire these many years to come unto you,
speaker: Narrator

text: when I leave for Spain, I will come unto you; for I trust to see you on my journey and to be taken there by you, if first I may enjoy your company.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it has pleased those of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints who are in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: It has pleased them verily, and they are their debtors. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, they should also minister unto them in carnal things.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that, when I have concluded this and have delivered unto them this fruit, I will come by you unto Spain.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that when I come to you, I shall come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I beseech you, brethren, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the charity of the Spirit, that ye help me with prayers to God for me,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may be delivered from the disobedient in Judaea and that the offering of my service to the saints in Jerusalem may be accepted,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may come unto you with joy by the will of God and may be refreshed together with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: I commend unto you Phebe our sister, who is a servant of the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} which is at Cenchrea,
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye receive her in the Lord as a worthy saint, and that ye assist her in whatever thing in which she has need of you, for she has been a helper of many and of myself also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus
speaker: Narrator

text: (who have for my life laid down their own necks; unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of the Gentiles);
speaker: Narrator

text: likewise greet the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} in their house. Salute my wellbeloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet Mary, who has laboured much with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen and my fellowprisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Apelles, approved in Christ. Salute those who are of Aristobulus’ household.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Herodion, my kinsman. Greet those that are of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord. Salute the beloved Persis, who laboured much in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren who are with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of Christ salute you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I beseech you, brethren, mark those who cause dissensions and offences outside of the doctrine which ye have learned, and avoid them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they that are such do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly and by smooth words and blessings deceive the hearts of the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your obedience is come abroad unto all places. I am glad therefore on your behalf, but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good and innocent concerning evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the God of peace bruise Satan under your feet quickly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Timothy my fellow worker and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, Tertius, who wrote this epistle, salute you in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gaius my host, and of the whole congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} salutes you. Erastus, the chamberlain of the city, salutes you, and Quartus, a brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, be with you all. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to him that is able to confirm you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery which was concealed from times eternal
speaker: Narrator

text: but now is made manifest, and by the writings of the prophets, by the commandment of God eternal, declared unto all the Gentiles, that they might hear and obey by faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: to God, only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
